page.title: 11THE POST OFFICE SWANAGE
page.content: Swanage Post Office was opened in 1972 and was built where a garage used to stand. Before 1972 the Post Office was in Station Road where Currys' Electrical shop is now situated. There are 16 postmen, 1 inspector and 1 post master. If a 1st class letter is posted between 5.45pm and 10.15am in Swanage, it is postmarked by hand and delivered in the next post. Mail arrives at the sorting office from Bournemouth and Wareham. The postman puts the mail into inward frames which have the names of the roads in Swanage. Then they are sorted into delivery frames which have the numbers of the houses on them. The postman starts to deliver at about 7.00am. Each man has his own route, on foot, on bicycle or by van. There are two deliveries of mail six days a week.
